item.title: Discovering Informal Learning Cultures of Blind Individuals Pursuing STEM Disciplines: A Quantitative Ethnography Using Listserv Archives
item.description: This work has been presented in the First International Confrence on Quantitative Ethnography, and awarded The Cengage Fellowship.

item.title: Is the Maker Movement Inclusive of ANYONE?: Three Accessibility Considerations to Invite Blind Makers to the Making World
LaTeX is NOT Easy: Creating Accessible Scientific Documents With R Markdown
item.description: This work has been presented in the 34th CSUN Assistive Technology Conference in Anaheim, CA, U.S (Wednesday, March 13, 2019 - 1:20 PM PST).

item.title: Furthering Inclusivity in Making: A Framework for Accessible Design of Makerspaces for Learners with Disabilities
item.description: This poster has been presented in the 2018 American Educational Research Association in New York City, NY.

item.title: Accessibility, Making and Tactile Robotics: Facilitating Collaborative Learning and Computational Thinking for Learners with Visual Impairments
Embracing Learners with Visual Impairments in CSCL
item.description: This work has been presented in the 2017 International Conference on Computer-Supported Collaborative Learning in Philadelphia, US.
